header.gameNote: GLOBAL SPORTS HOOPS SHOWCASE AT AUBURN AL

article.headline: Middle Tennessee 68, Samford 55
article.story: AUBURN, Ala. -- James Washington scored 12 points, including nine from 3-point range, as Middle Tennessee defeated Samford 68-55 on Saturday at the Global Sports Hoops Showcase. Josh Davis, who scored 30 points and made eight 3-pointers for Samford (2-2) in its win over Auburn on Friday night was held to seven points and attempted only two shots. Washington contributed a three-point play on a layup and free throw during an 11-0 first-half run that gave the Blue Raiders (2-2) a 23-10 lead 6:51 before halftime. Jason Jones added 11 points for Middle Tennessee, including a pair of layups during that run. The Bulldogs, who were led by Drew Windler's 15 points, trailed 31-16 at the half and never got closer than 11 points after that. The Blue Raiders were able to prevent a Samford rally by making their free throws. Twelve of their last 14 points came from the line in the final 3:53.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
